thread.title: Star Was has just officially dropped a bombshell about The Last Jedi
thread.title_full: Star Was has just officially dropped a bombshell about The Last Jedi

author: Gianluca Mezzofiore
title: Star Was has just officially dropped a bombshell about The Last Jedi
text:
Since the Star Wars: Episode VIII title dropped in January, fans all over the word have one pressing question in their mind:
Is The Last Jedi singular or plural?
SEE ALSO: Daisy Ridley won't even tell freakin' Judi Dench what 'The Last Jedi' means
If the title is singular, you can assume that The Last Jedi refers to Luke Skywalker. Or maybe Rey? Who knows.
If it's plural, it might refer to Luke and Rey. Nobody really knows.
However, the official Italian Star Wars Facebook and Twitter account have posted what appears to be a major hint to the real meaning of The Last Jedi.
It translated the title to "Gli ultimi Jedi", which unequivocally refers to more than one Jedi:
Gli Ultimi Jedi, dicembre 2017 al cinema. pic.twitter.com/t0AuvTrmSK
â€” Star Wars Italia (@StarWarsIT) February 17, 2017
Boom. Mic drop.
We don't know whether this is accidental, but the revelation has certainly stirred shock and excitement amongst Italian speaking fans of the saga.
BONUS: The US Army just flew a Star Wars-like hoverbike
